author: gratefulnat
title: Nothing spectacular, but jetpack figures.
review:
The build is straightforward, nothing exciting, but I certainly do like the combinations of grey - the color scheme is much better than the previous tank from Ep III, set 7258, and structurally this new tank is certainly stronger, although there is no seat for a driver droid. The only fun I had with the build was the 'eyes', very neat the way they are connected. The printed round plates are also a plus. There is a 2x10 plate with some inverted slopes that can be used to 'catapult' the figures, hmmm, about on par with some of the poorer functioning flickfire systems - basically blah. I would have preferred a driver droid than the 7 pieces needed for this catapult.

The droids are droids, nothing needs be said. The two jetpack clones certainly save this set in my opinion. The jetpacks are as such recognizable, but could have used a little coloring - the white of the jetpacks does not stand out well against the white clones.

Overall, a fun playset for the kids, jetpack figures for us oldies, so I rate this a 3 out of 5.

author: skipp
title: Corporate Alliance Tank Droid AKA Snail Droid
review:
Well, I bought this along with Echo Base the other week, for about 26 euros in a german TRU. The set comes with four minifigures, including the new jet troopers.

The jet troopers are basically normal clones, except with a brand new piece: The jetpack. It molded plastic, and the neck bracket is wider than usual. The other Figures are two Battledroids.

Onto the tank. Not much playability. The front ' feet' can lift up, so that if it needs to go up a hill or something...It can roll perfectly on carpet, but I took out one of the pins in the tread because it was sagging slighty. as always, they built in flickfire missiles on the left and right. It is slightly smaller than the older Snail Droid.

Onto the final bit, the catapult. It basically a couple of bricks slapped together, where you set your clone on, and slap your hand on the other end. The clone does a summersault and lands on his head. Ouch.

I think this set is overpriced, and because of this I give it a 4.

author: P13c30fch33s3
title: Good for Army Building
review:
As the title says, this set is good if you want to build up an army. It does have its down sides, but I'll get to those later.

Clone Troopers:
Nothing special. Except for the jetpacks. the jetpacks areof a very good design.
I also recommend this even if you only want the jetpacks.

Good points:
Jet packs

Bad points:
Nothing else is new

Battle Droids:
Nothing too special either. The Battle Droid needs something more, but you can never have too many. Especially if you have the MTT.

Good Points:
You can never have enough

Bad Points:
A bit boring now - needs something to bring more interest

Mini Catapult...Thing (Not displayed in picture):
Basically a few bricks slapped together. Nothing spectacular at all. If you lift it into the air, it works quite well as a catapult. Problem is, in a reality situation, the Clone Troopers would fly then die because they flip and land on their heads. Not very healthy.

Tank Droid:
This is the centrepiece of the set. It is smaller than the EpIII Tank Droid But the rear axle (and wheels) is sturdier.

Good Points:
The back wheels do not roll off the axle (unlike the old one).
The front 'treads' pivot up and down (unlike the old one).
The bottom cannons are flick-fire missiles (unlike the old one).
The 'eyes' are more movie accurate (unlike the old one).
The large discs are printed (like the old one).
The tread moves smoothly and does not get stuck (unlike the old one).
It is movie/episode accurate (like the old one).

Bad Points:
It is smaller than the old one.
It looks too short (unlike the old one).

Summary:
Good IF:
You want jetpacks
you want more battle droids/clones
you want a(nother) tank droid
you like playable sets

Bad IF:
You are very picky on movie size-accurateness (It is meant to be as big as the AAT but it is a bit smaller)
You want good value for money

Thank you for reading this far. Hopefully this has helped you decide whether to buy this or not. I recommend you do.

author: jjr
title: cool, but..
review:
okay this is my first 2009 summer set. I've been waiting very long for it because the snail droid is my favorite star wars vehicle since I got the set Wookie attack.

the box shows the tank droid rolling towards the two clones, one of them flies towards the tank and the other one doesn't seem to be interested at all because he looks the other way.

the minifigurers: notting to fancy, 2 regular battle droids, and 2 clones with new jetpacks, wich are cool

the build: also nothing really special, maybe even to simple for me.

the tank: the tank is cool, it looks like the one from the clone wars. the massive improvement are the eyes. it has 4 lasers, 2 of them are flick fire.
the tank can roll much better than it's predecesor even on flat area's. howver comparerd to the old version or the new AAT it looks really dumitive. 

price: ouch time! 27 euro's is just to much for this.

overal: cool set, I like it that I have it, but it's just to much money for such small set. I can't belive that if I buy two of these, I can have for the same money an AAT.

author: Phoenixfighter
title: 7748 Corporate Alliance Tank Droid
review:
I was really lucky  to find this on a shelf in the Warehouse, luckily I had achieved a great school report and was able to get it. This set is actually really cool, It is way better than the old Tank Droid and has a million more cool and interesting features.

Everything on the tank has changed from the old one. The eyes, the guns even the way it moves along the ground is better. The thing I find annoying is the two platform/ ski like panels on each side of the tank spin around, I understand why they do that (When going over hills/ bumps they turn to get the tanks over in one piece) but I still find it kind of irritating, but that is no reason not to buy this set.

The new Clone Jet Troopers are really awesome, (I personally think that they should have some sort of pattern/ detail on them to tell them apart from normal Clones) their jet packs are small but really appealing. And the Droids are just the same as always.

The price of this set is surprisingly fantastic! I was expecting a solid $60.00 NZ but instead I scored a $50.00 + a 20% discount! Making this set 40 bucks, a great buy.

There is one thing that is slightly disappointing about this set which is why I gave it a 4/5. If you place this set next to the 8018 AAT, it appears to be a lot smaller. In the Clone Wars series these two tanks are about the same size, but fortunately LEGO has forgotten that.

Do not let my one con stop you buying this set, it is a really good by and great for building up huge armies.

Phoenixfighter

author: capnrex
title: Corporate Alliance Tank Droid
review:
This is another totally fantastic set! The figures are very good and the tank droid looks very much like it does in the film.

I will start with some information about the minifigures! These are very nice, especially the jet troopers, you can really see the effort Lego must have put in to designing the new jetpacks. The battle droids are common but you can't have to many!

The Tank Droid is so accurate to the film and rolls very well, also, although I don't mind stickers, for everybody reading this who does, the detailing on the tank is printed on. The tank also has flick missiles which I quite like, and if you flick it properly it can go about two feet!

Overall I would certainly recommend this set, it is a fair price, and with the brand new jet troopers this is a spectacular set!

5/5

author: THX_1138
title: A very good set
review:
This set is pretty good. It's better than the original, without the ugly orange, and with more accurate photoreceptors.

Pros:
-Price is reasonable.
-Awesome new jet packs on the clones. Hopefully we'll see a Boba/Jango Fett with a helmet separate from the jet pack.
-Pretty accurate.
-Although it is too short, this MOD here: http://www.eurobricks.com/forum/index.php?showtopic=33300 (not mine) shows how to make it better looking and more accurate, using only the extra treads and the useless clone 'catapult.'
-You can never have enough battle droids.
-Very nice printing on the dishes on the sides.
-No stickers (I don't care much but most fans do).

Cons:
-Too short (this doesn't really count though since it can easily be fixed.
-Flick-fire missiles (these stay in pretty well though).
-$20 SW sets don't really exist any more, although like I said the price still isn't that bad.

Overall, this is a very good set, and should not be missed.

author: legoreviewer
title: Corporate Alliance Tank Droid
review:
This set is alright. It's a good buy but a bit pricy and a bit overrated honestly.

Minifigs:2 battle droids and 2 jet troopers nothing too special here, just the jetpacks whick are like backpacks but in um jet form..

Build Process: Takes about 30 minutes for an average builder to build. In my opinion building it was a bit boring and easy. The treads can be a bit annoying and it comes loose easily. But it can be fixed if you just remove one of the treads and stretch the rest out to make it tighter.

Final Product:Looks cool and it kinda fun. No stickers in this set. It would be a good army builder if the price went down slightly. This set also comes with a "catapult". It's supposed to launch the troops into the air as if they were flying, but it kinda fails and is pointless in my opinion.

Overall: 4/5 good set but price, size, andboring building takes away from this set. But all in all i still reccomend it.

Happy Building!  ;)

author: captain_radda_radda
title: "sigh" Oh well at least I got some troops out of it
review:
When I first got wind of another snail tank, I was ecastatic. I misssed the first one so I wanted to grab this one up ASAP. I was dissapointed. This set is VERY lackluster. It brings nothing new to the star wars seen and is actually quite boring. The bumbers in the front flop around and the treads always get stuck. There is no droid pilot(unlike the last one), the eyes are too small(unlike the last one), and the colors are accurate, but boring(unlike the last one). I could on and on about the negatives but hey, I got it on sale for $19.99 at Target! This is a fair price considering it has 4 figs and slightly over 200 pieces. The jettroopers are nice, but overall, kind of boring. They feature no excess detail besides the jump pack and have no unquiness to them. 

Pros:
The figures are good, but overall, nothing new. 
No stickers 
Good price for what I got it for, but $25 is way overpriced.
Good army builder, and I still want to get 2

Cons:
Too small
The cannons dont move
The treads get stuck a lot
The eyes are  too small
The figs are boring
The launcher is dumb
The bumpers flop around
The set has no features

Overall:
If you need seperatist forces, get it. If not pass. I want 2 because I have no MTT, so my seperatist army relys on size and not big vehicles. The sale lasts until saturday at your local target, so pick it up for the price it should be. Think of this though: for what it costs to buy two of these, you could buy an AAT.

author: Ha876
title: Good Army Builder
review: This set is pretty cool because it comes with jet troopers(X2) and they make a great addition to your clone army. Also you get a couple battle droids and tank droid for your droid army. The corporate alliance tank droid a.k.a snail droid is very durable and the thread works nicely. If you take one of the thread pieces off then it will be able to go faster. The flick fires work nice too. I would give this set a 8.5/10.

author: Alex1
title: BEWARE OF JET TROOPERS!
review:
When I got this set I was really happy because I'm currently building a clone army now lets get to the pros and cons 

                                               :Pros:
                                            the jet troopers,
                                            the droids 
                                            the tank itself
 
                                               :cons:
                                                the launcher
                                                 the treads 
    56 Pieces of treads the price goes up 10$ for every 50 pieces it goes up 5$
     + the treads get stuck a lot

author: Darthleapyous
title: A DEFINITE 5 OUT OF 5 STAR WARS SET!!
review:
I love this set,the droids the jet troopers the EVERYTHING!here are the pros and cons!

Pros:
1. jet troopers
2. droids
3. tank droid
4. flick missiles
5. treads

Cons:
treads sometimes dont move properly

overall:
a G-R-E-A-T set,i cant believe people only give it a 4 or 2 or something under 5. Get it, it's a definite *****

author: darkdean88
title: Flippin' expensive
review:
I picked this up at Target the other day (they had a sale, 5 buck off) and i was surprised. i originally bought it just to have it, just to have it, but its actually a really great set! 

Its pretty small, but the play abilitys are nice.

Pros:
Nice jets packs
eyes look great
treads work well
and overall detail is good
no stickers!

Cons:
short
no real structure
i wish it came with some super battle droids

so overall, its a pretty sweet set if you can get it on sale

author: legolover1200
title: fwoosh, these troopers are aewsome!
review:
this set is hard to review. i love it because of the jet pack troopers. a trooper+ jetpack + seperate helmet= head articulation= aewsomeness!! comes with flick fire missiles on the tank, two battle droids, two jet pack troopers.

pros;
.the tank is verry nice
.jetpack troopers
.i like the grey and black coloring
.good amount of figures for the set
.a good price for how many bricks there are
.the lights are cool

cons:
.i hear its smaller than the other
.using the jet pack trooper launcher is kind of hard for the minifigure to successfully fly
.the treads feel a little loose so i took off two treads and it moves just fine on carpet, but put all on when moving it an a hard surface.

author: Carl
title: Great
review:
This is a really good set. It is much better than the old one in Wookiee Attack (it was orange and blue!) The new Jet troopers are really cool to.

Pros:

Jet Troopers
Droids
New tank droid is awesome

Cons:

Front parts turn

Really awesome set.

author: ian
title: tank droid + jet pack clones = awesome set!
review:
first off let me say this set has gotten a lot of negative criticism. So I was a bit reluctant to buy it. However when it was finally assembled I must say this one of the best small sets I have bought! 

PROS
sturdy
cool guns 
rolling treads
just plain awesome looking
jet pack clones
droids


CONS
price 27 euros! 
ugly pathetic catapult 
size a bit too small


OVERALL
Great set get it quick!

author: HQuiff
title: Over Par!
review:
This is my first Star Wars set I have gotten in years, and I'm glad I did. This set offers such a lot, and is definitely worth 25 Euro. To be honest, I got it on sale which was handy, as before hand it was a mind-boggling overpriced - 35 Euro! Scary, I know.

For a start, this set takes perseverance to get around the minor flaws, in other words, you need a bit of imagination (Cheesiness alert!!) and some observational tweaks. If you're not prepared to do that then I advise you don't get it.

Certain aspects like the treads have some problems, e.g they don't roll, on any surface. However here are some very simple things you can do that can easily fix your problems:

1. Take off one or two of the Treads and see how you get on!
2. Are you finding that the two roller wheels at the back keep coming loose? Then take the inner round piece off, and just keep the umbrella like bits on and the dark blue gray pieces on top of those.
3. One thing you should do is take a look at the clog located at the top of the vehicle, or around about. You'll need to move it down one, so it becomes loose rather then tight. I don't know if this is actually a mistake I made in the instructions, hmm...

OK, now that I've been nit-picky about certain functions lets get onto what's good about this set! For starters, it's not as colorful as the other one, which makes it not only look more realistic but it adds to it's versatility.
The design used for the eyes is pure genius as well! It can move 360 Degrees and is more then easily maneuvered (That's the wrong place to put that word, isn't it? Thought so)! The overall design is sturdy and features like the new missile work really well.


The Playability Factor is also very high, almost setting a new standard. It fits well in any Star Wars base and runs smoothly over any baseplate. 
Onto the Minifigures! First up the Droids, my favourite! As I do not have any Droids with hands facing up ways, this was a great treat. They look very new, but still have the classic look. As for the Clones - these are spectacular! The detail is really very realistic and the Jetpacks are very exclusive, and well executed.

All and all this is a top Star Wars set, which is well over par! I recommend it to anyone who likes Star Wars, Droids, Clones, and LEGO, to be honest. Probably 83.2/100, or around about.
HQuiff

author: kaboomlegoman
title: Pretty good.
review:
This set is really cool.  I like how it has new jetpack troopers. They're awesome.

Minifigures: I just love the minifigures. It's a kinda random set to have jetpack( I wish this spell-check would shut up) clones in, but all the same, it's cool. Nothing new with the droids, though.

Building: Very fun. Treads, technic, and I just love it.

Pieces: Pretty good pieces, but the best thing that makes this set deserve a 5 is... PRINTED PIECES!!

Playability: Very playable, but the catapult for the clones is kinda worthless.

Price: Well, not good. The new Droid Tri-fighter has nearly 60 pieces more, and it's the same price. The Hyena Droid Bomber has nearly 10 pieces more, ( This is not exact) and it's 5 dollars less!

Overall: Cool set. I don't see why everybody criticizes it ( Well, at least noobs do) and I think it's pretty good.

author: legofan666666
title: COOOL!
review: I have to start off by saying this is one of the few "cheaper" starwars sets around. The Jet troopers are awesome, and look pretty realistic. Everyone knows, that of course, that the droids cant stand with their gun straight out in front of them. The Alliance Droid is really cool, because of the tread. The tread ACTUALLY "rolls" when you move the tank. The playibility is great. The catapult, for me it didnt really work. Insted of the catapult, they probably could have added another droid. Like I said before, this set has a GREAT PRICE for what is comes with. i have added this to my collection, and say it works well with other sets. This set comes with a good amount of minifigures. Overall I would say a 9.4/10

author: Alemas
title: Probably this is the last review of 2009!
review:
This set features a tank droid, 2 battle droids, and 2 brand new jet troopers! The clones have a one-piece jet-pack, with a wide collar. The battle droids have the new blasters and a straight arm(which goes on the right side). The tank droid has rolling tracks, and work quite well, but that's only on carpets! However, if you loosen the rear gear "disks" it works pretty well on smooth surfaces too! The flick-missiles... well, CAN'T work! They are under the guns, and that rear parts of the guns prevent you from flicking the missiles! It's terrible! The eyes are very cool, even if it's easy to move about the eyes! Also, it features a "clone launcher", which is really pathetic! It barely works! BTW, all those chain links don't bother me at all! It lengthens the build, which I like! Onto the pros and cons:

Pros:

Tank droid
Working tracks
Chain links
Jet troopers
Battle droids
Cool-looking
Menacing

Cons:

"Clone launcher"
Flick-missiles

Overall, a very good set! Happy New Year everybody! ;)

author: kresszaa
title: watch out for the alliance tank!
review:
this is a great set that i recommend to anyone who doesnt have it. here are the pros and cons.

pros  

 jet troopers
4minifigure
great playabillity
worth the money
printed parts
no stickers!
fun to build
easy to build
cheap

cons

weak catapult
the tank is too small 

overall

very great set 10/10

author: legodude12321
title: Very nice
review:
This is a truly amazing set! Its a great army builder seeing as you get a nice tank droid, two droids and two AWESOME jet clones.

This set is pretty ok for the money becasue you get two big printed pieces and a pair of brand new jetpack pieces.

 This set barely has any pieces and thats why i think they didn't put the piece count on the box.

Other than that its a really great set that i think is worth getting.

It comes with a pathetic clone launcher that flings them far with enough power.

There are flick-fires that are stupid because once flicked the canon is gone.

The treads work great and the design is really nice.

Theres not much to the set but get it for the jetpacks.

author: legoDad42
title: Fun tank set!
review:
Very cool, fun tank set. Nicely designed and the tank seems close to the one it's based on. 

PRO's- Tank design, moving center treads, long flick fire missiles, 4 mini-figures (2 Battle-Droids, 2 Clone Troopers with neat little white jet packs on their backs). Also cool is a little 'launcher'. You stand the figure into it and simply snap down(do it quickly and hard) on the front of it and it'll send your little Jet Pack Trooper soaring! 

CON's-Tank treads don't seem to move well on smooth surfaces. Rougher surface like a bed or carpet or on the couch works great. 

I recommend it.

author: DarthSteve
title: A Miniature Work of Art
review:
Stunning. That's all I can say. This has to be one of the coolest smaller sets I have in my collection. If I had enough money right now, I'd buy a dozen more to build the frontline of my Trade Federation Army. The price isn't bad either. In Canada, it goes for about $30.00, which is the same price as the Hailfire & Spiderbot Droid set over here. A notable point about this set is that there are no stickers; the side plates are printed. Hooray!

This set comes with a launcher to simulate the Jet Clone Troopers 'flying' although I never used it. However, that should not be counted against it, it's just that I generally display my sets and don't play with them. And I have to say, the chain link tread on the Tank Droid rocks!

These things are a great addition to your army! I can't find a single flaw with this set at all. I would love to see this model released in a much larger scale, but then again if they did, it probably wouldn't be movie accurate, which I'm also critical of with STAR WARS sets. It is a Tank 'Droid' after all, not a tank. I strongly recommend this set to every LEGO STAR WARS fan!

Now then, on to Pros & Cons...

Pros:
Minifigs: Battle Droid (x2), Jet Clone Trooper (x2)
Great Detail
Printed Side Plates
Chain Link Tread

Cons:
None

author: thewish
title: Run away! Giant rolling tank!
review:
Used by the Separatists on marshy words, the Corporate Alliance Tank Droid is, as its name suggests, a rolling tank droid, armed with two ion charged cannons and two missile launchers. The set itself is quite cheap and easily found (however, I got mine at a rip-off price in Hamleys at 10 quid more) and is a nice addition to your army. The minifigs included are two jet troopers (exclusive) and two battle droids. The only major niggle I have is that the tread is comprised of 56 independent pieces, which take 10 minutes to get your tread built.

PROS-
Two jet troopers
Great addition to your army
Battle Droids
Well armed
Rolls well

CONS-
Tread takes an age to put together
Only rolls on carpet surfaces
Flickfires don't work

Apart from a couple of niggles, this set is decent value and is a great addition to your droid army.

author: LEGOwikiguy
title: Construction Tank rolls into battle...wait, that's not for construction. Stupid treads...
review:
Well, LEGO, you really messed up this time. If you consider buying this set for more than $25 USD, then you need to slap yourself until you realize it's not worth more (or really that price). I know this sounds REALLY bad, and well, that's because it is, but not without its pros:

Pros:
1. Two more droids and new clones with Jetpacks! 
2. Very realistic
3. Sturdy

Cons:
1. Treads dont work, set doesn't even move!
2. Eyes are awkwardly placed and move
3. Too easy a build for price and parts, yet some major build stressors that aren't hard, just wierd and annoying

Parents: This is a sort-of easy build, but still some stressors (See above). I do not recommend this set to anyone unless you own every Star Wars 2009 set but this.

2/5, second choice, 1.5/5...

author: Darth_Sidious2
title: Pretty Good
review:
This set retails for $24.99 USD, and includes 216 pieces. If excluding each thread piece (56 total), you have a 160 Piece set, with 4 generic figures (No, the "Jetpacks" doesn't improve the clones enough to make them not generic) for $25. I have nothing against the set, I actually love it, but $19.99 should be it's price. No reason to justify $5 more. This is why it gets a 4 out of 5.

Pros:
- Best attempt at a Tank Droid yet. Remember the orange one?
- "Jetpack Clones" (Though I'm not too impressed, I can't really see how they could have improved them!)
- Battle Droids have Blasters (Cough AAT)
- No Stickers

Cons:
- Scale isn't perfect (Droids cant stand on sides, too short/stubby)
- PRICE!

Definitely a good set, and if Lego dropped the price $5 and threw in another 10 bricks to make it more realistic in terms of scale, it would be a perfect set. A-

author: Legend234
title: Not bad.
review:
I bought this set for £22, it has 160 pieces (not including the treads) and this is a good attempt at a tank droid (much better than the previous). Anyway onto the review:

Minifigs: We get 4 minifigs, two jetpack clones (Regular clones but have a one piece jet pack with a collar) with blasters and two regular droids with blasters. Nothing really amazing about the minifigs and the jetpacks are good, I just thought we could have got an entirely diffrent minifig for the jetpackers.

7/10 for the minifigs

The build: The build is longer than you think because you have to fit all the treads together which is deathly boring, apart from that it is okay fairly quick build.

6/10 for the build

The tank: The tank looks very similar to the ones in the star wars universe, the only problem is that none of the droids can fit on the side like in the movie (on kashyyyk) which I found anoying because I would have used it as a people/droid carrier.

8/10 for the tank

The features: The tank has very few features and most of these dont work very well. First of all there are the long flick fire missiles which don't work you flick them and they dont even go an inch. The treads dont work on smooth services (e.g wooden floor) but they work on carpets and beds etc.

6/10 for the features

This just narowly scrapes a 4 for the jetpack troopers.

author: ceroknight
title: Im flying! boom!
review:
I got this set so I could get a chrome trooper. This is.....decent. I was in a hurry and I just picked a random $30 set which I really regret doing knowing I could have got Echo Base....... Heres the Pros And Cons:
Pros:
  • Jet packs(like bobas)
  • Good addition for armies both seperatist and republic
  • Tank droid rolls really well
Cons:
  • Very small, size of three squash balls forming a 'L' shape
  • No big point of the clone catapult (more like a suicide machine) Id prefer an extra clone or droid or even a jedi/sith
  • flickfire of coarse
  • 100% overpriced!
 Id get more battle packs then get more of these middle sized lego sets that are overpriced and somewhat useless unless you have like ten of them and trying to make a movie

Thanks

author: The_Dumb_One
title: Jet Trooper crash-landing
review: This set is totaly worth buying... The snail droid is well designed and rolls well. I believe we've already figured out that practicaly any flick missiles work, so when i bought this, i knew that. The main problem with this set is that the clone launcher just doesn't work. You put the guy on, hit the other end, the guy launches, and falls on his face after about 5 cm... The overall is that you should get this set mainly for the snail droid and the jetpacks (i hate those weird battle droids with straight arms...).

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: Awsome army builder!
review:
The Corporate Alliance Tank Droid set (7748) is a LEGO Star Wars set which came out in 2009. It's part of the Clone Wars movie and it comes with 4 minifigures and 216 pieces. This set doesn't include any stickers.

Minifigures:

  • Battle Droids: The Battle Droids are very basic. Both droids come with blaster rifles.
  • Jet Trooper: The new Jet Troopers come with awsome new jetpacks and a catapult to launch them.
Corporate Alliance Tank Droid:

The Corporate Alliance Tank Droid (also known as Snail Droid) comes with 2 flick-missles. The 'eyes' can be moved and it comes with a nice tread.

Positive:

  • Jet Troopers
  • Catapult for Jet Troopers (You can also use that for Battle Droids if they explode)
  • No stickers
Negative:

  • It should have cost 20 Euros instead of 25 Euros.
All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on LEGO Shop@Home, eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure.

Videos I made of this set:

Review: http://www.youtube.com/user/KLOKRIECHER#p/search/1/gvsyA9lIjTo

Stopmotion: http://www.youtube.com/user/KLOKRIECHER#p/search/0/_-SZ8HsR0kc

author: evilempire22
title: Decent set if you can find it below MSRP
review:
I bought 2 of this set when I found it on clearance at Target for $12.49 a piece.

Pros:
  • Got 2 for price of 1, mainly because I wanted a set of tank treads to use for other models.
  • Jet Pack Troopers
  • No stickers, yay!

Cons:
  • Way over-priced at MSRP.
  • Construction is very flimsy...Tank Droid wobbles just moving it around.
  • Catapult for Jet Pack Troopers is lame. Would have rather preferred a separate vehicle for the minifigs to ride around on, as there is no place to put them on the Tank Droid itself.
All in all, not a very good set. Only bought 2 because they was on clearance, and I wanted the minifigs for my ever-expanding army, and the tank treads for some other free-form building ideas I have.

author: cooldanman22
title: incredible set
review:
ill start with the pros and cons

pros

  • great minifigs
  • new jetpack x2
  • amazing tank
  • eyes move

cons

  • costs 5$ too much
  • launcher should have been a clone speeder bike

 

id give this set a 2 out of 10 in building difficulty. I highly recommend you get this set.

author: IamLegoman1475
title: Part I of the Christmas Sets Trilogy: The tank that almost is perfect.
review:
This was one of three sets bought for Christmas 2010, the other two will be revealed as they come (heh heh) Anyway, this set has good minifigures, standard droids, but for me they were my first and not only droids (Assassin droids don't count) The Jetpack troopers are real good and they liven the set up. The tank droid that can be modified along with the clones guns (Which I did, putting a round 1x1 on one) The price actually does the set justice, which benefits us all.

     Here's the little troubles: The tank is almost perfect. I feel that the tank treads limit movement in the droid. It also is hard to put on. Other then that, it's allright. The clone launcher doesn't do much , but it can be used in creations, which is good.

Pros

  • Good figures
  • Tank has good weapons and look
  • Allright price

Cons

  • Tank treads are a little off in difficulty and usage
  • Clone launcher just isn't necessary

Overall, it's a good set that is nice to buy, especially for Christmas.

author: reidak12
title: okay but tiny
review:
This is a nice rendition of the Corporate Alliance tank droid, but it is so small and dinky! it is also slightly overpriced, but they all are nowadays. However, it does roll relatively well on soft surfaces.

Pros:

realistic

rolls well

no innacurate cockpit like in the 2005 version

unique clone troopers

extra battle droids

Cons:

small

pontoons are attached to practically nothing

guns are flick fire missiles [so wrong]

the catapult thing is stupid

the best thing I can say about this set is that it is great for a clone wars battle scene. If you have gift cards or can find a discount, it's a good buy.

author: stitchfan
title: Treds and Feds
review:
Need some Treds for that Tank project you're working on? Want some Droid and Clone figures? This is probably your best bet then. I agree with most others on this being an overpriced set, likely due to the fact that it has 4 mini figures and other parts of collectors interest. However, for the amount of working, moving, useful, and cool parts you get, it's still fair enough.

Pros

  • Treds! 56x of them... Plus other useful moving/hinge parts parts
  • 4 Mini figures, 4 blasters, and 2 rocket packs, & other Star Wars parts
  • Decent playability

Cons

  • Flimsy model, not suggested for rough play (might actually bend/snap parts!)
  • Slightly overpriced due to part types included
  • Catapult feels like a waste of parts since you practically have to stomp it for 6" of flight

In short, if you want the parts, or can find it at a discount price, buy it.

author: tkettle9719
title: Finally, a large droid that's a vehicle!
review:
I got two of these sets from my uncle and stepdad for Christmas (separately, of course), and went ahead and returned my stepdad's in for Echo Base (which is also amazing). This is proof that this is a well-made, cool set.

Pros

  • The blue-gray works charmingly here.
  • There are no stickers in this set; only printed discs!

Cons

  • The amount of treads is needed, but ridiculous.
  • The trooper catapult is a smart idea, but doesn't exactly work.

This is a really cool set, a fine remake of the 2005 version (this one is cheaper, though). This set is recommended to all who love Star Wars (at least Episode III).

author: 123MrBrick
title: Middling in almost every way.
review:
It's time again for my yearly review of a set no one cares about anymore.

I've had this set since it was released and decided a while back to rebuild it as it has a number of distinct parts that were easy to locate in my bins. It took the very tight grip of boredom brought on by current events for me to even consider making the dive.

Box/Instructions

The box art is nice enough, depicting a rather tightly-packed action scene which appears to take place on Christophsis. As far as I can tell from my very cursory research, this droid never took part in the fighting on that planet. I say that only because there isn't much else to say. The instructions are efficient and clear enough, though they do continue the irritating habit of not listing what parts are involved in each step. Not so much of a problem here but on larger models it's easy to miss a small piece that appears on the build between steps without warning.

Parts

Let's get the obvious out of the way, roughly a quarter of this set's parts count is eaten up by the tread links that wrap around the center of the droid. Whether this is a good or bad thing is up to you. This is one of only eleven sets to include them; maybe you'd like them for a MOC. But dividing the number of links into two, three, four treads isn't going to produce a very large vehicle. Most of the rest of the pieces are standard fare for anyone with a degree in LEGO Star Wars, but the two large printed dishes are quite nice, and generic enough that they could be repurposed for any number of things. Thankfully the color palette throughout is consistent, with little to speak of in terms of brightly colored internals for inexplicable reasons.

Minifigures

The humble battle droid is coming up on its twenty-second year of service very shortly. A pair of these make for a very nice inclusion in my opinion; super battle droids would have disappeared into the tank droid's own color scheme and any other units would have likely been too specialized for those looking to army build this set. If it ain't broke, don't fix it.

The jet troopers are similarly simple, being nothing more than the standard The Clone Wars clone trooper with the addition of a jetpack.The part itself is pretty common these days but this is one of only two sets to include it in white. I like the inclusion of these figures as well; they provide the good guys a bit of a boost, if you will, in the face of what is clearly a villain-focused set. Were this set to be released today it would cost $50 instead of $25, to facilitate the inclusion of yet another oversized BARC speeder for the clones, because the bad guys can never have anything for themselves.

The jet troopers are a fun little way to spice up your clone army, and they can also be easily demoted to regular clones if you prefer uniform line-ups. Their generic nature promotes army building in the same way the standard battle droids do. No intrusive named characters to throw off the balance.

The Build

Tedious is the first word that comes to mind. I do not mind Technic at all and in fact embrace its inclusion in normal sets. However, I will admit a pet peeve of mine is Technic builds that center on axles that have to be aligned just so. Getting them perfectly centered to accommodate symmetrical components on either side always irritates me a little. Then of course there is the matter of attaching all fifty-six individual tread links to each other. Thankfully mine are all still intact, but with the way they connect together I can see the potential for the ends of one or more to snap off if you aren't careful. Other than that the build is just a matter of creating mirrored components and hooking them up to the center body. Tedious and a little repetitive.

The Completed Model

It sure looks like a Corporate Alliance Tank Droid. I'm not a very big fan of the finished product as a toy, but as a display piece for your Clone Wars shelf or diorama it's good enough. Some issues:

The cardinal sin for a rolling toy, it can't roll on hard surfaces. Thanks to the “cushion” bricks on the bottom of the pontoons it will glide along just fine without damaging your floor, but the whole appeal of having the giant exposed tread is to see it move. It works wonderfully on carpet and other soft surfaces and makes a nice clicking sound thanks to the Technic gears involved, but it really is a shame this tank isn't all-terrain.

The whole thing feels pretty flimsy. The pontoons aren't locked in place and can very easily be knocked out of alignment when you pick it up, or even while it's rolling along. The tenuous and finicky connections on the eye stalks and cannons aren't fun either. In fact, the giant dishes themselves have a lot of play in their connections to the center body, both vertically and horizontally.

The lower rear is really oddly designed, with a mix of colors and textures filling out the gap between the main body and the back wheel. It doesn't look cohesive or even like it was meant to replicate some machine detailing and instead feels more like an oversight on the designers' part.

Though not backed by any source material as far as I can tell, I really appreciated how the 2005 version of this droid had an interior pilot's seat that was cleverly hidden behind the dishes, to the point where you couldn't even tell it was there at a glance. I would have gladly sacrificed the thin profile of the main body and made it just a little wider if it had meant the inclusion of a similar mechanism here.

However, credit where credit is due: I appreciate the articulation in the eye stalks, even if the design isn't the best as I mentioned above. I like the design for the flick-fire missiles so that they both blend in with the stationary cannons above them and that when fired the vehicle does not look naked or unarmed. The droids have a place to stand on the front of the pontoons even if they are likely to get blown away by the cannons right behind them. And the rolling feature really is great fun when it works.

I absolutely love the printed dishes as well, I think their design has a lot of charm and they take care of all the need for detailing along the sides with just one piece.

There is also an innocuous side build in the form of a little catapult to launch the jet troopers from. Personally I haven't been able to get this to work effectively, they just end up flopping out right in front of the thing no matter how hard I slam down on the front. I do appreciate the effort, though, and that it is built entirely with parts from the tank droid's color scheme so if you don't like it you could conceivably cannibalize it to modify the droid.

Summary

I think this is probably the best of the three versions of this design LEGO has put out. The 2005 one has the fun cockpit feature but it is only part of a large and rare set, and in very strange colors to boot. The 2013 one was out of place in the Geonosis lineup, overly detailed and lacking the cool prints of the previous two, and was just a cynical way to get out the new Jango Fett minifigure.

If you're just looking for a fun set to pick up, this is definitely not for you. It's fiddly and lacking the wow factor or any really great play features. For the dedicated Clone Wars fan, now or in 2009, I could understand picking up a couple of these to fill out your Separatist ranks and your minifigure legions. It's a decent-sized model that looks the part and fits well with other artillery like the MTT or AAT.

If you're familiar with any of my more recent reviews, the lack of passion in my written voice here compared to in those is the best indicator I can give you that I'm just lukewarm on this set.

author: jeroenaa95
title: cool set.
review:
I own only 1 of these, but I want at least 2 more. I bought it myself, it is not too expensive, I think. I love this set and play with it a lot.

 

Pros:

- No stickers!!

- 4 minifigs (2 battle droids and 2 jetpack-clone troopers)!

- Great CAT-Droid.

 

 

Cons:

- should be a droid commander, in my opinion.

- clone catapult is quite useless.

 

Overall a great set, good for army building.
